snippet: The disclosure of a Hungarian connection to the attacks has raised the question of whether jihadist militants have joined a flow of asylum seekers.
abstract: Terrorist investigation into Paris attacks broadens to include Eastern Europe after discovery that suspect Salah Abdeslam traveled to Hungary several times before attacks; two people who came back with him from Hungary, Samir Bouzid and Soufiane Kayal, are also identified as suspects in investigation.
lead_paragraph: The disclosure of a Hungarian connection to the attacks has raised the question of whether jihadist militants have joined a flow of asylum seekers.

headline.main: Inquiry Into Paris Terror Attacks Widens to Eastern Europe
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Into Paris Attacks Expands to Eastern Europe, Where a Suspect Traveled

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
